Latent Force ModelsÂ¶

Somewhat loosesly a latent force model is a time-dependent linear Ordinary Differential Equation (ODE) where the time dependence arises from a collection of latent Gaussian processes. We distinguish between two classes of such models; the first is the additive latent force model

\[\dot{\mathbf{x}}(t) = \mathbf{A}\mathbf{x}(t) + \mathbf{S}\mathbf{g}(t),\]

where \(\mathbf{g}(t) = (g_1(t),\ldots,g_R(t))^T\).

We also consider the class of multiplicative latent force models

\[\dot{\mathbf{x}}(t) = \left(\mathbf{A}_0 + \sum_{r=1}^{R}g_r(t)\mathbf{A}(r)\right)\mathbf{x}(t),\]
  • The Additive Latent Force Model
  • The Multiplicative Latent Force Model
    • Model Setup
